question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [VM Integration] [Bypass mechanism] Can an attacker craft a transaction whose script hash accidentally matches an approved hash for a completely different proposal, bypassing mempool limits maliciously? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [VM Integration] [Cache invalidation] If the ApprovedExecutionHashes config is updated mid-block, can cached values in the VM cause inconsistent validation across transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [VM Integration] [Parallel execution] In Block-STM parallel execution, can concurrent reads of this config lead to race conditions where some transactions see old hashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Struct: ApprovedExecutionHashes] [Cleanup failure] If remove_approved_hash() fails to clean up after proposal execution, can stale hashes remain forever allowing replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Governance Integration] [Unauthorized addition] Can non-governance transactions modify this config through direct state manipulation, bypassing access controls? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Governance Integration] [Hash injection] During proposal creation, can an attacker pre-compute hashes and inject them before proposal resolution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Governance Integration] [Multi-step proposals] When add_approved_script_hash() updates hashes for multi-step proposals, can race conditions cause hash confusion between steps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Governance Integration] [Proposal ID reuse] After a proposal is resolved and removed, can the same proposal ID be reused to re-add malicious hashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Governance Integration] [Execution order] If multiple proposals add hashes simultaneously, can non-deterministic ordering cause consensus disagreements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [State Consistency] [Cross-language sync] Since Move uses SimpleMap and Rust uses Vec, can deserialization inconsistencies cause different nodes to have different views? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [State Consistency] [Atomic updates] Are updates to this config atomic at the block level, or can partial updates cause inconsistent state during epoch transitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [State Consistency] [Merkle tree] Does this config contribute to the state Merkle root, and can inconsistencies cause fork risks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [State Consistency] [Reconfiguration] During validator reconfiguration, can this config be in an inconsistent state causing new validators to reject valid proposals? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [State Consistency] [Snapshot restoration] If a node restores from snapshot, can stale ApprovedExecutionHashes cause validation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Field: entries] [Hash algorithm] What hash algorithm is used for Vec<u8>, and can preimage or collision attacks find malicious scripts with matching hashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Field: entries] [Hash length] Are hash lengths validated, or can short hashes (e.g., 1 byte) increase collision probability exponentially? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Field: entries] [Hash truncation] Can hash truncation attacks where only prefix matches are compared allow bypass of the approval mechanism? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Field: entries] [Second preimage] Can an attacker find a second preimage for an approved hash to execute unauthorized code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Field: entries] [Hash malleability] Are the hashes computed deterministically, or can script formatting changes produce different hashes for semantically identical code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/approved_execution_hashes.rs] [Access Control] [Direct state write] Can a malicious validator directly write to this config's storage location bypassing Move access controls? (Critical)
